person.persName: Henry J. Lyons (Kentucky, bank officer, asst QM, prov govt commissioner)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, bank officer, soldier, and provisional government commissioner. Washington, D. C., native. Married to Laura W. Simmons Lyons in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on June 8, 1852. Father of Willie L. Lyons and Henry J. Lyons. Bank exchange officer in Louisville in 1860. Employed Mary Murphy as a domestic worker in 1860. In business as Quigley, Lyons, & Co. in Louisville in 1861. Served as assistant quartermaster for Kentucky in Louisville in June 1861. Nominated as bank commissioner to the Confederate States of America by the provisional government of Kentucky on November 28, 1861. Removed from post November 30, 1861.
